tweet: Our health care system is in crisis. Labs are working beyond capacity causing dangerous backlogs, which affects our contact tracing & case management. Hospitals are nearing capacity, and we're seeing more outbreaks in LTC homes. Our system can't handle much more of this. (6/10)

Our health care system is in crisis. Labs are working beyond capacity causing dangerous backlogs, which affects our contact tracing & case management. Hospitals are nearing capacity, and we're seeing more outbreaks in LTC homes. Our system can't handle much more of this. (6/10)

Thanks, @CBCNews, for inviting me to the conversation. I advocated for public health transparency, improved access to testing, paid sick leave, smaller classrooms, support for public education, primary care, LTC.   Disappointed by the sexist remarks made on air by my colleague.

On our end, labs & hospitals are increasing capacity, we're training more case managers & further LTC rules are being implemented. But these things take time. And time is a luxury we can't afford. That's where you come in. Your actions matter. Maybe more than you realize. (8/10)
